unnormalised: As Diwali approaches, manufacturers are under pressure to meet surging demand for everything from electronics to mithai. But meeting deadlines shouldn't compromise quality. Rigorous quality control (QC) is crucial throughout the supply chain, especially during peak seasons.

unnormalised: The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras recently published a white paper emphasizing Statistical Process Control (SPC) techniques. SPC helps monitor and control processes by analyzing data in real-time, preventing defects before they occur.
normalised: the indian institute of technology (I I T) madras recently published a white paper emphasizing statistical process control (S P C) techniques. S P C helps monitor and control processes by analyzing data in real-time, preventing defects before they occur.

unnormalised: Proper QC encompasses material inspection (ensuring the correct grade of steel for Tata Steel, for example), process monitoring (verifying cooking temperatures for Haldiram's biryani), and final product testing (evaluating the durability of a Godrej almirah). Ignoring QC can lead to customer dissatisfaction, costly recalls, and damage to brand reputation. Companies like Mahindra are investing heavily in automated QC systems, using AI to detect anomalies in production lines. Implementing ISO 9001 standards and training employees in QC methodologies, especially local supervisors like Mr. Sharma, are key to maintaining high standards.
